questions.question: 1. TIn fluorescence, cytoskeleton stained through Phalloidin derivative (Alexa Fluor 488) appears
2. In fluorescence, mitochondria stained through MitoTracker (CMXRos) appears
3. Using fluorescence microscopy, which of the following can be observed:
4. Which of the following indicates the best cytocompatibility (only using fluorescence microscopy images):

answers.a: By selecting the region of image with very high numbers of cells
answers.b: By complementing with in vitro test
answers.c: By complementing with in vivo test
answers.d: By flattened morphology displayed by adhered cells

questions.question: 5. Fluorescence microscopy will be able to tell whether a material is cytocompatible:

answers.a: Yes, cytocompatibility can be clearly confirmed
answers.b: Yes, cytocompatibility can be easily quantified
answers.c: Yes, can provide an indication through in vitro tests
answers.d: Yes, and needs no confirmation via in vivo tests
